title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep-debt-tracker is a simple web application built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML, designed to help users visualize and manage their accumulated sleep debt. This project leverages TypeScript for a more structured and maintainable codebase, offering a clear and interactive way to track sleep patterns and address sleep deficits.

title: devboard
description: Devboard is a full-stack project management application built with Next.js 14 (using the pages router), TypeScript, and a modern UI powered by Material UI (MUI). This project leverages React Query for efficient data fetching and management, providing a structured and scalable foundation for organizing tasks and tracking progress within a development workflow. It serves as a practical example of implementing a robust web application with key technologies for modern web development.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository hosts a web-based interface for visualizing and interacting with data from a robotic fleet, built using JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS. This project provides a user-friendly platform for monitoring robot status, viewing sensor data, and controlling robot actions, facilitating efficient management and control of robotic deployments. It's focused on delivering a clear and intuitive representation of fleet activity, streamlining robotic system operation and analysis.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project showcasing a modern and responsive dashboard built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript. It demonstrates best practices for structuring a Next.js application, including server components, data fetching, and UI design, providing a solid foundation for building complex web applications and user interfaces.

title: raven-v2
description: Raven-v2 is a project built with TypeScript and JavaScript, aiming to [insert project's main purpose or goal, e.g., "provide a streamlined note-taking experience" or "demonstrate a modern web application architecture"]. This repository explores concepts related to [mention key project topics, e.g., "state management, data fetching, and UI component design"] and serves as a practical implementation of [mention key technologies or techniques used, e.g., "React, Redux, and a custom API"]. Find more details and usage instructions within the project's documentation.

title: resume
description: This repository contains the LaTeX source code and generated PDF for my resume, along with an HTML version for online viewing. It showcases my skills and experience in a clear and professional manner and serves as a project demonstrating my proficiency in both TeX typesetting and web development principles. The project aims to provide a consistently updated and readily accessible resume in multiple formats.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository contains Jupyter Notebooks and Python code implementing various financial analysis and modeling projects. It explores key financial concepts using practical examples and demonstrates how Python can be used for tasks such as portfolio optimization, risk management, and financial data analysis. Aimed at learners and practitioners, this project offers a hands-on approach to applying Python in the field of finance.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript that provides a simple and intuitive way to brainstorm, organize, and visualize ideas. This interactive idea board allows users to easily add, edit, and arrange ideas, fostering collaborative thinking and efficient project management. Inspired by the desire for a streamlined and visually appealing brainstorming tool, this repository offers a starting point for building and customizing your own digital idea canvas.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: This GitHub repository, "Map-Visualisation," showcases a project focused on creating interactive map visualizations using HTML and Python. It demonstrates techniques for displaying geographical data and generating informative maps through code, aligning with topics related to data visualization and web-based projects. The project's goal is to provide a practical example of how to integrate mapping functionalities within a web application using these technologies.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a Python-based CRUD application built with Flask, PostgreSQL, HTML, CSS, and shell scripting, designed as a learning project. It demonstrates fundamental web development principles, including database interactions, user interface design, and server-side logic, while exploring core concepts related to creating, reading, updating, and deleting data. The project serves as a practical example of building a full-stack web application using a microframework and a relational database.

title: atg-world
description: ATG-World is a project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, focusing on [mention the core functionality/purpose from the README if available, e.g., interactive 3D world exploration or a data visualization dashboard].  This repository serves as the codebase for [mention the project type, e.g., a personal portfolio project, a team collaboration effort, or a learning exercise], exploring practical applications of these technologies.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: The dynamic-event-calendar repository offers a customizable and interactive JavaScript-based event calendar. Built with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, this project allows users to easily display and manage events dynamically within a clean and intuitive interface. This simple, lightweight project provides a foundation for integrating event scheduling and display into web applications.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: This repository contains a full-stack IoT asset tracking application built with Next.js, TypeScript, and Supabase. Leveraging Tailwind CSS for styling and JavaScript for interactive elements, this project provides a user interface for managing and monitoring the real-time location of assets. Explore a modern approach to IoT data visualization and asset management using serverless technologies.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a simple, yet functional, voting application built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript. This project aims to provide a clean and user-friendly interface for creating and participating in polls, demonstrating modern web development practices and serving as a practical example for learning these technologies. It focuses on clean code and efficient implementation, making it a great resource for anyone interested in learning or contributing to full-stack web development using the Next.js framework.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a full-stack project built with TypeScript, CSS, JavaScript, HTML, Vite.js and Express.js that leverages the Gemini API to provide an interactive and engaging user experience. This repository demonstrates a modern approach to web development, exploring the integration of AI models with web applications for a dynamic and intelligent interaction.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool for visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log files, making it easier to debug and understand robot behavior. Built using JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting, this project provides a user-friendly interface to filter, search, and display log data, ultimately streamlining the ROS development and debugging workflow.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-Seller is a full-stack e-commerce project built with Next.js 14 (using the Pages Router), TypeScript, and React. Leveraging MUI for a polished UI and React Query for efficient data fetching and caching, this repository showcases a type-safe approach to building a dynamic online fruit marketplace. It provides a practical example of integrating modern web technologies to create a responsive and performant shopping experience, demonstrating key concepts in e-commerce development.
